Class IncomeController

java.lang.Object
Classes.IncomeController
public class IncomeController extends Object
Manages income records for a user, including adding, editing, and deleting income entries in a database. This class interacts with the database to store and manipulate income data associated with a user.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    IncomeController(User user, Connection c)
    Constructor for the IncomeController class that initializes the user, database connection, and sets up a Scanner for user input.

  • Constructor Details

    • IncomeController

      public IncomeController(User user, Connection c)
      Constructor for the IncomeController class that initializes the user, database connection, and sets up a Scanner for user input. It also creates the incomes table if it doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      user - the user object associated with the income records
      c - the database connection used to interact with the incomes table

  • Method Details

    • menu

      public IncomeController menu()
      Displays the main menu for managing income records and handles user input to perform operations.

      This method provides the following options: 1. Add Income: Allows the user to create a new income record and store it in the database. 2. Edit Income: Enables the user to modify an existing income record by its unique ID. 3. Delete Income: Removes an existing income record identified by its unique ID.

      For operations requiring an income ID (Edit/Delete), this method validates the user-provided ID to ensure an existing income record is being modified or removed.

      Returns:
      null (this method does not return a meaningful value)

    • addIncome

      public void addIncome()
      Adds a new income record by collecting details from the user and storing them in the database.

      This method: - Prompts the user to enter a unique income ID and validates that it doesn't already exist. - Collects the income source, amount, and date from the user, ensuring they are valid. - Inserts the new income record into the database with the associated user's email.

    • editIncome

      public void editIncome(String id)
      Edits an existing income record by allowing the user to modify its source, amount, or date.

      This method provides the following options: 1. Source: Modifies the income's source. 2. Amount: Updates the income's amount. 3. Date: Changes the income's date. 4. Change All: Updates all fields (source, amount, and date).

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the income record to be edited

    • editSource

      public void editSource(String id)
      Updates the source of an existing income record in the database.

      This method: - Retrieves and displays the current source of the income record. - Prompts the user to enter a new source and validates that it is not empty. - Updates the income's source in the database.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the income record to update

    • editAmount

      public void editAmount(String id)
      Updates the amount of an existing income record in the database.

      This method: - Retrieves and displays the current amount of the income record. - Prompts the user to enter a new amount and validates that it is greater than 0. - Updates the income's amount in the database.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the income record to update

    • editDate

      public void editDate(String id)
      Updates the date of an existing income record in the database.

      This method: - Retrieves and displays the current date of the income record. - Prompts the user to enter a new date and validates that it is not empty. - Updates the income's date in the database.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the income record to update

    • deleteIncome

      public void deleteIncome(String id)
      Deletes an income record from the database based on its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the income record to be deleted

    • validateId

      public boolean validateId(String id)
      Validates whether an income ID exists and belongs to the current user.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the income record to validate
      Returns:
      true if the ID exists and belongs to the user, false otherwise
